meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tinny.
meanings.sent1: The tinninesses of the metal pot made it sound hollow.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the tinninesses of the music coming from the old radio.
meanings.sent3: The tinninesses of the cheap speakers made the music sound like it was underwater.
meanings.sent4: The tinninesses of her voice echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The tinninesses of the wind chimes filled the air with a delicate sound.

meanings.definition: The sound quality of being thin and metallic.
meanings.sent1: The tinninesses of the bell made it stand out in the orchestra.
meanings.sent2: The microphone picked up the tinninesses of the singer's voice.
meanings.sent3: The tinninesses of the robot's speech made it sound like a tin can talking.
meanings.sent4: The tinninesses of the wind through the pipes created a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The tinninesses of the cymbals added a unique texture to the music.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a tinny taste.
meanings.sent1: The tinninesses of the water from the old pipes made it undrinkable.
meanings.sent2: The tinninesses of the canned food lingered on my tongue.
meanings.sent3: The tinninesses of the soda reminded me of metal coins.
meanings.sent4: The tinninesses of the medicine made it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent5: The tinninesses of the tea hinted at the metal cup it was brewed in.
